text: is it okay to be chubby in Japan a
conversation about when it's acceptable
to be an overweight woman is taking
place on Japanese social media it all
started when this chart from a breakfast
TV show was posted on Twitter it
outlines the difference between okay
chubby and no-good chubby
it's okay to be a chubby woman if you
smile and put an effort into your
appearance it's no good if you wear drab
clothing and frown the image has been
retweeted
thousands of times mostly by men having
a go at chubby women it's much less
normal or acceptable to be larger in
Japan the obesity rate is amongst the
lowest in the developed world well
personally I did fill certain amount of
pressure to look skinny growing up in
Japan I guess it does exist everywhere
but women in Japan tend to be skinnier
so I guess it adds to that pressure but
there seem to be Japanese men who now
prefer to date a bigger woman there's
now a word for it a deadly sin which
means I only date chubby a woman but
does the fact that these conversations
are happening at all point to a shift in
attitudes towards overweight people in
Japan or are Japanese men too intolerant
tell us what you think by getting in
touch with us on Twitter using the
hashtag BBC trending
